body_html:
If you are a beginner on linux, we recommend starting with the command @MikeTam1021 suggested. Since GPU version requires a lot of non-trivial installation of CUDA, cuDNN, and manipulation of environment variables, you should definitely start with the CPU version.

If you are using ubuntu 14.04, you may need to run the pip install command with the URL as follows.

pip install --upgrade https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/cpu/tensorflow-1.0.0-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl
body_text:
If you are a beginner on linux, we recommend starting with the command @MikeTam1021 suggested. Since GPU version requires a lot of non-trivial installation of CUDA, cuDNN, and manipulation of environment variables, you should definitely start with the CPU version.
If you are using ubuntu 14.04, you may need to run the pip install command with the URL as follows.
pip install --upgrade https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/cpu/tensorflow-1.0.0-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl
body:
If you are a beginner on linux, we recommend starting with the command @MikeTam1021 suggested. Since GPU version requires a lot of non-trivial installation of CUDA, cuDNN, and manipulation of environment variables, you should definitely start with the CPU version.

If you are using ubuntu 14.04, you may need to run the pip install command with the URL as follows.
```
pip install --upgrade https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/cpu/tensorflow-1.0.0-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl
```
